intro: Paepalanthus chapadensis, commonly known as the Brazilian burr cucumber, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its fruits are rough, spiny, and typically green when mature, often used in traditional medicine. Paepalanthus chapadensis is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical environments with well-drained soil.
